properties.areaDesc: Wabash, IL; Daviess, IN; Knox, IN; Gibson, IN; Pike, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 15 at 8:44PM EST until January 24 at 2:30PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...Wabash River...White River...

.As of Wednesday evening, minor to moderate flooding either
continues or is forecast on the Wabash, White, and East Fork White
Rivers in central and southern Indiana.

Crests will be/are comparable to those that occurred in February
and June of 2019.

The Wabash River is cresting near Terre Haute. The crest will reach
Hutsonville Friday.  The White River crest is between Elliston and
Newberry.  The crest along the East Fork White River is nearing
nearing Rivervale. Flooding along the lower portions of the White
and Wabash River is likely to continue until the weekend of
January 25.

Little or no precipitation is in the forecast through Thursday,
which will allow drainage to continue out of area rivers this week.
Above normal precipitation is possible this coming Friday through
Saturday, which could exacerbate elevated water levels and lead to
renewed flooding on area waterways.  Precipitation is expected to
start off as snow then transition to rain late Friday into Friday
night.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Petersburg.
* until Friday January 24.
* At  7:30 PM Wednesday the stage was 24.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will rise to near 25.1 feet by Friday evening then
begin falling. It will fall below flood stage Friday January 24.
* At 25.0 feet...A flood has exceeded this level each year since
January 2004, 6 out of 7 years since May 2002 and 10 times since
May 1990.  Of these 10 recent floods, 7 of them have exceeded the
25.8 foot mark with the January 2005 flood the largest since
January 1937.  Prior to May 1990, one must go back to March 1964
for a flood above 25 feet and back to May 1961 for a flood over 26
feet.  The greatest known flood to strike the Petersburg area
occurred in March 1913.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
